noun.description: A government authority or license conferring a right or title for a set period, especially the sole right to exclude others from making, using, or selling an invention.
examples: he took out a patent for an improved steam hammer
designs in a wide range of textures featuring super-chic patent, soft suede, or sophisticated nappa
he wore black trousers and black patent shoes
she was smiling with patent insincerity

adjective.description: (of a vessel, duct, or aperture) open and unobstructed; failing to close.
Made and marketed under a patent; proprietary.

examples: an invention is not your own until it is patented

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin patent- lying open, from the verb patere. The noun sense is from letters patent.
